subject: Using Mock objects or another system?
msgSnippet: A coworker suggested that we don t use Mock objects because he thinks that it is better to test everything together (code, framework, application server and
messageBody:
A coworker suggested that we don't use Mock objects because he thinks
that it is better to test everything together (code, framework,
application server and database).

It have problems to convince him.

He wants to include two methods in the JUnit tests: makeTestData()
and deleteTestData(). The first method would be called before the
testing is started. The second method he wants to call after testing
is finished.

What he wants is to do in makeTestData() is to write test data into
the database for testing purposes. So he thinks we don't need Mock
objects.

We are not experienced both. But I read a lot of Mock objects.

He also objects that the JUnit testing would be done only with Mock
objects.

What do you think? Is it better to use Mock objects or to do it like
my coworker wants?
